intro_health:
The health system’s ability to respond to the covid-19 outbreak depends in large part on the health system capacity and the prevalence of risks factors for complications of COVID-19 in the population. See: Beyond containment: Health systems responses to COVID-19 in the OECD
The charts describe the situation before the outbreak; significant additional resources have been mobilised after the outbreak
The OECD Data indicators below are updated on an annual basis.
Next update: Early July 2020.
intro_wellbeing:
The short- and medium-term impacts of Covid-19 may increase the vulnerability of the most disadvantaged, and risk compounding socio-economic divides in people’s well-being. People in poor physical health face immediate risks from both Covid-19, and the wider strain currently placed on healthcare systems. In addition, a number of other economic and social factors could leave people more vulnerable to well-being losses. People living in poverty, or facing financial insecurity, those in overcrowded or unaffordable housing, and those who are socially isolated or with poor psychological well-being, are among those groups who will face particular challenges . Low-wage workers, people in non-standard jobs, those living with the threat of domestic abuse or violence, and those in need of mental health care or support for disabilities will also be at higher risk.
The OECD Data indicators below are updated on average 2/3 times a year.
Next update : Summer 2020.
intro_eco_impact:
The OECD system of Composite Leading Indicators is designed to provide early signals of turning points in business cycle. The component series for each country are selected based on various criteria such as economic significance; cyclical behaviour; data quality; timeliness and availability. The component series most widely used are as follows:
  • Manufacturing - Production: tendency
  • Manufacturing - Employment: future tendency
  • Services - Business situation: tendency
  • Services - Employment: future tendency
  • Consumer - Confidence indicator
  • Manufacturing - Export order books: level
  • Passenger car registrations
  • Share prices index

The economic indicators below are updated on a daily basis.
